member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base._TouchCalibStart
member.summary: Storage for VPG-24 signals

summary.para: Puts the V-Panel into touch calibration mode.
Sets the panel to auto mode.
In auto mode, the panel will auto-detect the docked status of the pen (which is physically mounted to the side of the V-Panel) as follows:
When docked( = true), this will enable finger mode.
When undocked( = true), this will enable pen mode.
Sets the panel to finger only mode.
When set to finger mode, the panel will only respond to touch input and the pen will not work.
Sets the panel to pen only mode.
When set to pen mode, the panel will only respond to pen input and the finger input will not work.
Sets the panel to dual mode.
When dual mode is active, the panel will recognize both finger and pen input.

summary.para: Raises the LCD backlight brightness by 1% on each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will auto-increment until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.
Lowers the LCD backlight brightness by 1% on each pulse
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until it reaches the minimum value of 0%.
Increments the screen display standby timeout by one minute with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds,the standby timeout period will auto-increment until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 120 minutes.
Decrements the screen display standby timeout by one minutes with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the standby timeout period will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until it reaches 0 minutes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.UseDmNetForHid
member.summary:
Property to select the destination DM Net where HID data will be sent. The selection will be active for as long as the input is true.
If both and inputs are true, the DM Net address takes precedence. HID data includes touch output data, and, if = false, keyboard/mouse data.
When set to "DM Net", the HID data will be routed via DM Net to the address specified by

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.HidUseAlternate
member.summary:
Property to select the destination Alternate where HID data will be sent. The selection will be active for as long as the input is true.
If both and inputs are true, the DM Net address takes precedence. HID data includes touch output data, and, if = false, keyboard/mouse data.
When set to "Alternate", the HID data will be routed to the alternate address specified by

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.HidUseKm
member.summary:
Property to select the destination where keyboard/mouse (KM) data will be sent, as follows:
When the input is true, the KM data will be sent to the address specified by . This will break out the KM data to the VMK-WIN.
When the input is false, the KM data will be sent to the "DM Net" address (when = true) or the "Alternate" address (when = true).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.UsbDeviceDetectedFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that a device is connected at the USB HID port. The output remains true for as long as the device is detected.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.TouchCalibrationStartFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate touch calibration start feedback status.
Indicates that touch calibration has been initiated by a console command. The output remains true for as long as touch calibration is in progress.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.TouchCalibrationCompleteFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate touch calibration complete feedback status.
Pulses to indicate that the touch calibration procedure is complete or has timed out.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.UseDmNetForHidFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate Use DM Net for HID feedback status.
Indicates the current HID destination (DM Net).
The output remains true for as long as the address is active.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.HidUseAlternateFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate HID use alternate feedback status.
Indicates the current HID destination is Alternate.
The output remains true for as long as the address is active.
is triggered for this property.

summary.para: Indicates that the hardkey on the V-Panel is pressed.
The output remains true for the duration of the button press.
is triggered for this property.
Indicates that the hardkey on the V-Panel has been pressed for 5 seconds, thereby requesting a reboot of the V-Panel.
The output will pulse when the reboot request is received.
is triggered for this property.
Indicates the current HID keyboard/mouse setting.
The output remains true for as long as the setting is selected.
true = Breakaway destination selected.
false = DM Net or Alternate destination selected
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.TouchCalibrationInProgressFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that the touch calibration procedure is in progress.
The output becomes true when is set to true and remains true for as long as the procedure is in progress.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.TouchCalibrationPassFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the result of the touch calibration procedure.
When "Pass" is true, this indicates that calibration was successful. The output remains true until is set to true again.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.TouchCalibrationFailFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the result of the touch calibration procedure.
When "Fail" is true, this indicates that calibration failed. The output remains true until is set to true again.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.AutoModeFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the panel is currently set to auto mode.
The output remains true for as long as the panel is in auto mode.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.FingerOnlyModeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate the finger only mode is active.
The output will remain true for as long as finger only mode is active.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.PenOnlyModeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate the pen only mode is active.
The output will remain true for as long as pen only mode is active
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.PenFingerModeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate the pen finger mode is active.
Indicates that the panel is set to dual mode. The output remains true for as long as dual mode is active.
is triggered for this property.

summary.para: Indicates that the pen is currently docked. The output remains true for as long as the pen is docked.
is triggered for this property.
Indicates that the pen is currently undocked. The output remains true for as long as the pen is undocked.
is triggered for this property.
Indicates that there is no HDMI source being routed to the DM input of the V-Panel. The output remains true for as long as no digital source is detected.
is triggered for this property.
Indicates the presence of HDCP. The output remains true for as long as HDCP is detected.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.SourceVideoLockedStatusFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the video image has been locked. The output remains true for as long as the video is locked. When the output is false, this indicates no picture.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.SourceVideoIsInterlacedFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the digital video source is interlaced.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.LcdBrightness
member.summary:
Property to set the LCD brightness.
Sets the LCD brightness level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.StandbyTimeout
member.summary: Property to set the standby timeout (1d = 1 minute). The standby timeout is the period from the last use of the touchscreen before going into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on). Valid values range from 0d (no standby timeout) to 120d (120 minutes)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.TouchCalibrationPositionXFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current X coordinates of the icon during touch calibration.
is triggered for this property.

member.summary:
Property to report the current coordinates of the icon during touch calibration.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.SourceHorizontalResolutionFeedback

Property to report the horizontal resolution of the input source in pixels (1d = 1 pixel). Reported values range from 0d to 1920d.

is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Vpg24Base.SourceFramesPerSecondFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the frame rate of the input source in 0.01 Hertz (1d = 0.01 Hz), e.g., 4989d = 49.89Hz.
Reported values range from 0d to 8500d.
is triggered for this property.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdSystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutUp
member.summary: Property to increment the standby timeout by one minute. The standby timeout is the period from the last use of the touchscreen before going into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on).
member.remarks: If the property value remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the standby timeout period will continue to increment every 25ms until the property value becomes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 120 minutes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdSystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDown
member.summary: Property to decrement the standby timeout by one minute.
member.remarks: If the property value remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the standby timeout period will continue to decrement every 25ms until the property value becomes false or until it reaches 0 minutes (no standby timeout).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdSystemReservedSigs.ShowCursorFeedback
member.summary: Property to indicate that the cursor is displayed.
member.para: The event will trigger with and .

member.summary: Property to indicate that the cursor is hidden.
member.para: The event will trigger with and .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdSystemReservedSigs.BacklightOffFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the DVPHD is currently in standby mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdSystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeout
member.summary: Property to set the standby timeout in minutes (1 = 1 minute).
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0 (no standby timeout) to 120 (120 minutes).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdOotbfStaticReservedSigs.StaticPage1x1Window1TransitionDuration
member.summary: Property to specify the duration for Cut, Fly and Stretch effects, where 1 = 0.1s for Static Page 1x1 video window 1.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0 (transition occurs in 1 frame) to 30. Out of range values will clip the transition duration to 30.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.Ptt
member.summary: Triggers PTT (push-to-talk) transmission when connected to a PTT device. 'true' - Trigger PTT transmission. 'false' - Stop PTT transmission.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.Muted
member.summary: Mutes the outgoing audio from the device when set to true.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.PttMode
member.summary: When set to 'true', enables push-to-talk (PTT) mode and switches the touch screen into half-duplex modeallowing voice transmission in only one direction at a time while the cue is 'true'. Set to 'false' to disable PTT.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.PttFeedback
member.summary: Indicated that PTT transmission is active. 'true' - PTT active. 'false' - PTT inactive.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.MutedFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that audio transmission to the target device is muted. 'true' - muted.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.PttModeFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the target device is PTT. The output is 'true' for as long as PTT mode is enabled. In addition, a BPT system pulsing this cue will enable audio to a door stations connected via the PREVIEW function. When the output is 'false', this indicates a full-duplex device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.CommandString
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.GroupToDial
member.summary: Used to dial multiple devices at once. All devices in the group will ring. Once one answers, the remaining calls will be terminated

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tsr302VoipReservedSigs.CommandStringFeedback
member.summary: Reserved for future use.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdOotbfOverlayReservedSigs.Window1OverlayTextX
member.summary: Property to set the X coordinate of the overlay text, either with the text box or transparent, when "custom" positioning is selected ( value is 0) for video window 1.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0 to 1919 (1 = 1 pixel). If set beyond the width of the video window, the text will be placed at the edge of the window.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGA
member.summary:
The TPMC-8X-GA is a 2-way WiFi touchpanel. It features an 8.4" active-matrix SVGA display, integrated 5-way thumbpad and up/down arrow buttons, four programmable "softkeys" positioned below the touchscreen, and a Crestron Rava full duplex SIP/VOIP intercom.
The TPMC-8X-GA is built on the Microsoft Windows XP Embedded operating system, allowing it to run Windows applications.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAEmbeddedAppsReservedSigs.PowerPointSlidePrevious
member.summary:
Moves the slide presentation (of the PowerPoint Viewer embedded application) back to the previous slide on the falling edge of the input.
The input has no effect when the presentation is at the first slide.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAEmbeddedAppsReservedSigs.PowerPointSlideNext
member.summary:
Advances the slide presentation (of the PowerPoint Viewer embedded application) to the next slide on the falling edge of the input.
The input has no effect when the presentation is at the last slide.

member.summary: Turns off the cursor in Internet Explorer, on the rising edge of the input.

On-Screen Keyboard displays a visual keyboard with all the standard keys.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAEmbeddedAppsReservedSigs.IEOSKOff

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.EnterSecuritySetup
member.summary: Opens the "Security Setup" dialog. This dialog configures system account settings and passwords, network connections and browser options.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.ExitSecuritySetup
member.summary: Closes the "Security Setup" dialog.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.EnterEthernetSetup
member.summary: Opens the "Ethernet Setup" dialog. This dialog shows the current IP address and mask, and gives access to the TCP/IP setup page.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.ExitEthernetSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Ethernet Setup" dialog.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.EnterTouchScreenSetup
member.summary: Opens the "Touchscreen/Console Settings" dialog. This dialog is used to set up serial settings for console communication, and gives access to touchpanel calibration screens.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.ExitTouchScreenSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Touchscreen/Console Settings" dialog.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.EnterAudioSetup
member.summary: Opens the "Audio Setup" dialog. This dialog configures settings for WAV files and microphone audio.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.ExitAudioSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Audio Setup" dialog.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.EnterDiagnosticsSetup
member.summary: Opens the "Diagnostics" dialog. This dialog shows the firmware version of the unit and resets the End User License Agreement.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.ExitDiagnosticsSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Diagnostics" dialog.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.EnterDebugMode
member.summary: Opens the "Debug Output" dialog. This dialog gives access to the error log, sig number information and network connection data, for use during debugging.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.ExitDebugMode
member.summary: Closes the "Debug Output" dialog.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.EnterEmbeddedAppsSetup
member.summary: Opens the "Embedded Apps" dialog. This dialog shows a check box for enabling popup windows in Internet Explorer.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.ExitEmbeddedAppsSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Embedded Apps" dialog.

member.summary: Enables the display of popup windows in Internet Explorer.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSetupReservedSigs.DisablePopupsIE
member.summary: Disables the display of popup windows in Internet Explorer.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystem3ReservedSigs.EnableHardButton4Default
member.summary:
Enables the default behavior of hard button 4 for as long as the input is true.
The default function of hard button 4 is to release the panel from the wallmount docking station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystem3ReservedSigs.EnableHardButton4DefaultFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the status of the default behavior of hard button 4 (release panel from wallmount docking station).
When true, this indicates that the default behavior is enabled; when false, the default behavior is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystem3ReservedSigs.BatteryConditionRundownInProgressFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that battery conditioning is in progress. This will discharge whichever batteries are connected to the panel.
The output remains true until the panel shuts down (which happens automatically after conditioning is complete) or the user cancels conditioning.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystem3ReservedSigs.ForceInitiationOfBatteryConditioningFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Battery Cond." button on the Setup screen is being pressed. The output remains true for the duration of the button press.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAWiFiReservedSigs
member.summary: Extender class to provide access to the WiFi Reserved Sigs feature of the TPMC-8X-GA Touch Screen.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs
member.summary: Extender class to provide access to the WiFi Reserved Sigs feature of the TPMC-8 Touch Screen.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.#ctor(Crestron.SimplSharpProInternal.CrestronDevice)
member.summary: Device Constructor.
member.param: Device this extender is on.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationReleasePanel
member.summary: Notify the wallmount docking station to release (unlock) the panel.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.InitializeJoins
member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8Base WiFi extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationSecureMode
member.summary:
Activates secure mode for as long as the input is true.
When in secure mode, this displays the "Wallmount Passcode Release" dialog whenever the user tries to release the panel from the docking station. The user would then need to enter any of the five passcodes set in the "Wallmount Docking Station Setup" dialog, or the passcode set by .
When the input is false, this puts the panel into standard mode. In standard mode the panel can be removed by anyone.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationPlainTextPasscodeDialog
member.summary: Displays the passcode that the user enters into the Wallmount Passcode Release dialog in plain text rather than asterisks, for as long as the input is true. When the input is false, the passcode is displayed in all asterisks.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationDisableReleasePopupIcon
member.summary:
Disables the pop-up icon that is usually displayed whenever the panel is docked in the wallmount docking station, for as long as the input is true. The icon is a button that the user can press to release the panel.
When the input is false, the icon is displayed when the panel is docked.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.ACLineStatusFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the status of the AC power line. The output remains true for as long as AC power is on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.BatteryChargingFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the internal Li-Ion battery is charging. The output remains true for as long as the battery is charging.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.DockingStationConnectionStatusFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the docking station Ethernet link status is online, whether the docking station is the desktop cradle or the wallmount docking station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.InternalWiFiWAPConnectionStatusFeedback
member.summary: Indicates a valid connection to a WAP (wireless access point).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.DockingStationDockedStatusFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the panel is currently docked in a docking station, whether the docking station is the desktop cradle or the wallmount docking station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationDockedStatusFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the panel is currently docked in the wallmount docking station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationCarrierClosedStatusFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the status of the carrier, which holds the panel. When the carrier is open, the panel can be removed from the docking station. When closed, the panel is locked into the docking station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationPanelManuallyReleasedFeedback
member.summary:
Pulses to indicate that the panel has been manually released from the docking station.
(To manually release the panel, the user sticks a flat key on the top part of the docking station that releases the panel from the docking station.)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationSecureModeFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the panel is in secure mode. The output remains true for as long as the panel is in secure mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationPlainTextPasscodeDialogFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that plain text passcode display is turned on. The output remains true for as long as the panel is in this mode.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationDisableReleasePopupIconFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the pop-up icon for releasing the panel from the wallmount docking station is disabled. The output remains true for as long as the pop-up icon is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.BatteryLevelFeedback
member.summary: Reports the internal battery level from 0 (no charge) to 100 (full charge).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.BatteryDiscreteLevelFeedback
member.summary: Reports the internal battery level from 0 (no charge) to 9 (full charge).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.InternalWiFiSignalStrengthFeedback
member.summary: Reports the WiFi signal strength from 0 (no signal) to 100 (maximum signal).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.InternalWiFiDiscreteSignalStrengthFeedback
member.summary: Reports the WiFi signal strength from 0 (no signal) to 9 (maximum signal).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.WallmountDockingStationReleasePasscode
member.summary:
Pass code for removing the panel from the docking station when the panel is in secure mode ( = true).
The user can enter this pass code or any of the five passcodes that can be set in the Wallmount Docking Station Setup dialog.
The string can be made up of any ASCII characters (251 characters max).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.InternalWiFiIPAddressFeedback
member.summary:
The IP Address of the touchpanel.
The IP address is reported in dotted decimal format: X.X.X.X, where X is a decimal value ranging from 0 to 255, with no leading zeros.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.InternalWiFiSSIDFeedback
member.summary:
The SSID of the touchpanel. The SSID is a string of ASCII characters.
The SSID is the pre-defined network name.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.InternalWiFiMACAddressFeedback
member.summary:
The MAC address of the touchpanel.
The MAC address is reported in the format: XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX, where XX is a hexadecimal value ranging from 00 to FF (all caps).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.DockingStationIPAddressFeedback
member.summary:
The IP address of the docking station (desktop cradle or wallmount docking station).
The IP address is reported in dotted decimal format: X.X.X.X, where X is a decimal value ranging from 0 to 255, with no leading zeros.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.DockingStationMACAddressFeedback
member.summary:
The MAC address of the docking station (desktop cradle or wallmount docking station).
The MAC address is reported in the format: XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX, where XX is a hexadecimal value ranging from 00 to FF (all caps).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseWiFiReservedSigs.DockingStationBSSIDAddressFeedback
member.summary:
The BSSID of the docking station (desktop cradle or wallmount docking station).
The BSSID is the name given to the WAP (wireless access point) MAC address.
The BSSID is reported in the format: XX-XX-XX-XX-XX-XX, where XX is a hexadecimal value ranging from 00 to FF (all caps).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPHangup
member.summary: When pulsed, any current call it terminated and any incoming call is rejected without answering.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPPTT
member.summary:
Indicates that PTT transmission is active, whether triggered by the program or locally from the touch screen.
The output remains true for as long as PTT transmission is active.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPDoNotDisturb
member.summary:
Toggles the Do Not Disturb setting on and off with each rising edge of the input.
When Do Not Disturb is on, the touch screen will auto-decline all incoming calls.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPFuncDoorRelease
member.summary: Pulsing this join will send a message to open the exterior door associated with the currently connected BPT door station.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPFuncPreview
member.summary:
Pulsing this join will open a SIP connection to the first BPT door station in the system. Pulsing the join again while the current door station is connected will auto connect to the next door station in the system.
The connection will loop back around to the first station once the last has been contacted.

member.summary: Page all groups.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPConnectedtoServerFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the touch screen is connected as an SIP client to the SIP server. The output remains true for as long as a valid connection to the server exists.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPDialingFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the SIP call is currently dialing, or connecting.
The output remains true for as long as the call is connecting. The output goes false when the call connects or is terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPBusyFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the line being called is busy.
The output remains true until another call is placed or received.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPCallActiveFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the outgoing call has connected and is active.
The output remains true for the duration of the call. The output goes false when the call is terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPRingingFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that an incoming call is waiting to be answered or declined.
The output pulses every 2 seconds while the incoming call is ringing. The output goes false when the call is answered, declined or terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPIncomingCallFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that an incoming call has arrived.
The output goes false when the call is answered, declined or terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPHoldFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the current call is on hold.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPPTTFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that PTT transmission is active, whether triggered by the program or locally from the touch screen.
The output remains true for as long as PTT transmission is active.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPDoNotDisturbFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the status of Do Not Disturb.
When the output is true, this signifies that Do Not Disturb is On; when false, Do Not Disturb is Off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPCallTerminatedFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that a call has been terminated for any reason.
The output will pulse when a call is terminated.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPPTTModeFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the target device is PTT. The output remains true for as long as PTT mode is enabled.
When the output is false, this indicates a full-duplex device.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPRingbackFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the touch screen is waiting for a response to an SIP invitation from the target device.
The output pulses every 2 seconds while waiting for the remote party to answer.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGAVOIPReservedSigs.VOIPInit
member.summary:
The SIP configuration parameters.
Each field must be separated by the & symbol, with no spaces between fields.

member.summary: The SIP extension, group page or URI to dial.

member.summary: Sets the LCD backlight brightness level to High.

member.summary: Sets the LCD backlight brightness level to Med.

member.summary: Sets the LCD backlight brightness level to Low.

member.summary: Displays the Setup menu.

member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8Base System extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessUp
member.summary:
Raises the LCD backlight brightness by 1% each time the input is true.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessDown
member.summary:
Lowers the LCD backlight brightness by 1% each time the input is true.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will decrement every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the minimum value of 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutUp
member.summary:
Increments the standby timeout by one (1) minute each time the input is true. The standby timeout is the period from the last use of the touchscreen before going into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on).
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the standby timeout period will continue to increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 120 minutes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDown
member.summary:
Decrements the standby timeout by one (1) minute each time the input is true.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the standby timeout period will continue to decrement every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches 0 minutes (no standby timeout).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightness
member.summary:
Sets the LCD backlight brightness.
Valid values range from 0% (minimum brightness) to 100% (maximum brightness). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeout
member.summary:
Sets the standby timeout in minutes (1 = 1 minute). The standby timeout is the period from the last use of the touchscreen before going into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on).
Valid values range from 0 (no standby timeout) to 120 (120 minutes).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessFeedback
member.summary: Reports the LCD backlight brightness.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystemReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutFeedback
member.summary: Reports the standby timeout period.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.#ctor(Crestron.SimplSharpProInternal.CrestronDevice)
member.summary: Device Constructor.
member.param: Device this extender is on.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoOn
member.summary:
Turns on auto-mode for LCD backlight brightness control on the rising edge of the input.
This signifies that the LCD backlight brightness will be set to high (as defined in the TPMC-8L System2 Reserved Joins extender) when the light sensor detects that the current brightness level (reported by ) exceeds the level specified by LCD Brightness Auto Threshold.
Similarly, the LCD brightness will be set to low (as defined in the input of the TPMC-8L System2 Reserved Joins extender) when the light sensor detects that the current brightness level (reported by ) is below the level specified by LCD Brightness Auto Threshold.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoOff
member.summary: Turns off auto-mode for LCD backlight brightness control on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.InitializeJoins
member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8X System extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.PowerTimeoutUp
member.summary:
Increments the power timeout by one (1) minute with each rising edge of the input.
The power timeout function turns off the touchpanel display, shuts off WiFi and puts the processor to sleep when the touchpanel is inactive for the specified period. The power timeout has no effect when AC power is online.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the power timeout period will continue to increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 120 minutes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.PowerTimeoutDn
member.summary:
Decrements the power timeout by one (1) minute with each rising edge of the input.
The power timeout function turns off the touchpanel display, shuts off WiFi and puts the processor to sleep when the touchpanel is inactive for the specified period. The power timeout has no effect when AC power is online.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the power timeout period will continue to decrement every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches 0 minutes (no power timeout).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that auto-mode for LCD backlight brightness is turned on. The output remains true for as long as auto-mode is enabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the panel is currently in auto-mode. The output remains true for as long as auto-mode is turned on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.PowerDownTimeout
member.summary:
Sets the power timeout in minutes (1 = 1 minute).
The power timeout function turns off the touchpanel display, shuts off WiFi and puts the processor to sleep when the touchpanel is inactive for the specified period. The power timeout has no effect when AC power is online.
Valid analog values range from 0 (no power timeout) to 120 (120 minutes).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.PowerDownTimeoutFeedback
member.summary: Reports the current power timeout period.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XGASystemReservedSigs.LightSensorValueFeedback
member.summary:
Reports the ambient brightness level detected by the light sensor, from 0 to 100.
This value is used to adjust the LCD backlight brightness in auto-mode.

member.summary: The filename of the VTPro-e project that is currently loaded into the panel.

member.remarks: No two windows can have the same Z-order. Setting the Z-order of a window may cause the others to change. Valid values range from 1 (back) to 8 (front).

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8L
member.summary:
The TPMC-8L is a 2-way WiFi touchpanel. It features an 8.4" active-matrix SVGA display and 16 programmable hard keys.
The TPMC-8L is built on the Microsoft Windows XP Embedded operating system, allowing it to run Windows applications.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8L.#ctor(System.UInt32,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.CrestronControlSystem)

member.param: Ethernet IPID of the device.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystem2ReservedSigs.Standby
member.summary: Puts the panel into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystem2ReservedSigs.EnableHardButton1Default
member.summary:
Enables the default behavior of hard button 1 for as long as the input is true. The default function of hard button 1 is to toggle the keyboard. When in this mode all VT Pro-e settings are ignored.
When the input is false, this disables the default behavior and enables the settings specified in the VT Pro-e project, including page flips and digital press sigs assigned at the project and page level. (The keyboard can still be controlled via the Open/Close State joinsee TPMC-8L.)

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystem2ReservedSigs.ResumeFromStandby
member.summary:
Takes the panel out of standby mode.
The input has no effect if the panel is not currently in standby mode.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystem2ReservedSigs.InitializeJoins
member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8Base System2 extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystem2ReservedSigs.LCDHighLevelUp
member.summary:
Raises the LCD backlight brightness High level by 1% when the input is true.
The brightness level takes effect when the input is true (found on the TPMC-8L System Reserved Joins extender).
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseSystem2ReservedSigs.LCDHighLevelDown
member.summary:
Lowers the LCD backlight brightness High level by 1% when the input is true.
The brightness level takes effect when the input is true (found on the TPMC-8L System Reserved Joins extender).
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.

member.summary:
Sets the LCD backlight brightness High level that will take effect when the input is true (found on the TPMC-8L System Reserved Joins extender).
Valid values range from 0% to 100%. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.summary:
Raises the hard key backlight brightness by 1%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the hard key backlight brightness will increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystem2ReservedSigs.BacklightBrightnessDown
member.summary:
Lowers the hard key backlight brightness by 1%.

member.summary:
Sets the hard key backlight brightness.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoOn
member.summary:
Turns on auto-mode for LCD backlight brightness control on the rising edge of the input.
This signifies that the LCD backlight brightness will be set to high (as defined in the TPMC-8L System2 Reserved Joins extender) when the light sensor detects that the current brightness level (reported by ) exceeds the level specified by .
Similarly, the LCD brightness will be set to low (as defined in the input of the TPMC-8L System2 Reserved Joins extender) when the light sensor detects that the current brightness level (reported by ) is below the level specified by .

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoOff
member.summary: Turns off auto-mode for LCD backlight brightness control on the rising edge of the input.

member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8L System extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoThresholdUp
member.summary:
Raises the LCD backlight brightness threshold (reported by ) by 1.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the threshold will increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoThresholdDown
member.summary:
Lowers the LCD backlight brightness threshold (reported by ) by 1.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the threshold will decrement every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the minimum value of 0.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that auto-mode for LCD backlight brightness is turned on. The output remains true for as long as auto-mode is enabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoThreshold
member.summary: Sets the threshold level that is used in auto-mode for LCD backlight brightness control.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LCDBrightnessAutoThresholdFeedback
member.summary: Reports the LCD backlight threshold.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSystemReservedSigs.LightSensorValueFeedback
member.summary: Reports the ambient brightness level detected by the light sensor, from 0 to 100. This value is used to adjust the LCD backlight brightness in auto-mode.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.EnterBiometricSetup
member.summary: Opens the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog on the rising edge of the input. This dialog allows the user to configure the properties of the Biometrics database, e.g., it allows new users to be enrolled and enrolled users to be modified. It also adds/modifies categories and modifies the Biometric events.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.ExitBiometricSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.DisableBiometricSensor
member.summary: Disables the use of the Biometric sensor for as long as the input is true. This signifies that when a user swipes their finger on the Biometric scanner, the panel will not identify the user, and thus no actions will be taken.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.InitializeJoins
member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8L Setup extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.EnterBiometricSetupFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog is open. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is open.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.ExitBiometricSetupFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog is closed. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is closed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.DisableBiometricSensorFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the Biometric sensor is disabled. The output remains true for as long as the sensor is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.BiometricSwipedUsernameFeedback
member.summary:
The username (as entered into the Biometrics database) of the last user who swiped their finger on the scanner and was correctly identified.
The string is in the format entered into the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.BiometricSwipedCategoryFeedback
member.summary:
The category (as entered into the Biometrics database) of the last user who swiped their finger on the scanner and was correctly identified.
The string is in the format entered into the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8LSetupReservedSigs.BiometricSwipedFingerFeedback
member.summary:
Specifies which finger was swiped by the last user who was correctly identified. The string will be one of the following:
"Right Thumb""Right Index""Right Middle""Right Ring""Right Pinky""Left Thumb""Left Index""Left Middle""Left Ring""Left Pinky"

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdOotbfPresetReservedSigs.PresetUp
member.summary: Property to adjust the OOTBF page layout preset number up.
member.remarks: The selected preset can then be saved (via ) or recalled (via ).
If this property value is true for 0.5 seconds, then the preset number will auto-adjust every 25ms until the property value becomes false or until the limit is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdOotbfPresetReservedSigs.PresetDown
member.summary: Property to adjust the OOTBF page layout preset number down.
member.remarks: The selected preset can then be saved (via ) or recalled (via ).
If this property value is true for 0.5 seconds, then the preset number will auto-adjust every 25ms until the property value becomes false or until the limit is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdVideoControlReservedSigs.TranslucencyUp
member.summary: Property to adjust the translucency of graphic objects on the video window up by one step.
member.remarks: If the Property value remains true for 0.5 seconds the translucency will auto-adjust until the property value becomes false or until it reaches the maximum setting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdVideoControlReservedSigs.TranslucencyDown
member.summary: Property to adjust the translucency of graphic objects on the video window down by one step.
member.remarks: If the Property value remains true for 0.5 seconds the translucency will auto-adjust until the property value becomes false or until it reaches the minimum setting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdVideoControlReservedSigs.Translucency
member.summary: Property to set the translucency of graphic objects on the video window. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
member.remarks: Valid values range from 0 (0%) to 65535 (100%).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdVideoControlReservedSigs.TranslucencyFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the translucency value. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
The event will trigger with and .

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Dvphd
member.summary:
Ethernet based Multi-window video processor that displays high-res computer and high-definition video signals with HDCP, provides a fully-customizable HD graphical environment, and enables real-time annotation and touch screen control all in a modular, scalable hardware platform.
This class will trigger , , and events.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioBeepVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises the audio beep volume by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioBeepVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers the audio beep volume by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioLineVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises the line audio volume by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached. The final volume is also affected by the master volume controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioLineVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers the line audio volume by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%. The final volume is also affected by the master volume controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioWavVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises the WAV audio volume by 1% with each pulse. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached. The final volume is also affected by the master volume controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioWavVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers the WAV audio volume by 1% with each pulse. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%. The final volume is also affected by the master volume controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioMasterVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises the overall audio volume by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioMasterVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lower the overall audio volume by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioMicVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises the Mic audio volume by 1% with each pulse. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached. The final volume is also affected by the master volume controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioMicVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers the Mic audio volume by 1% with each pulse. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%. The final volume is also affected by the master volume controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.LcdBrightnessUp
member.summary:
Raises the LCD backlight brightness by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will auto-increment until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.LcdBrightnessDown
member.summary:
Lowers the LCD backlight brightness by 1% with each pulse.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the LCD backlight brightness will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until it reaches the minimum value of 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutUp
member.summary:
Increments the standby timeout by one (1) minute with each pulse of the input. The standby timeout is the period from the last use of the touchscreen before going into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on).
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the standby timeout period will auto-increment until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 120 minutes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDown
member.summary:
Decrements the standby timeout by one (1) minute with each pulse of the input.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, the standby timeout period will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until it reaches 0 minutes (no standby timeout).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.UseDmNetForHid
member.summary:
Property to select the destination DM Net where HID data will be sent. The selection will be active for as long as the input is true.
If both and inputs are high, the DM Net address takes precedence. HID data includes touch output data, and, if = false, keyboard/mouse data.
When set to "DM Net", the HID data will be routed via DM Net to the address specified by .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioHdmiVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises the HDMI audio volume by 1% with each a pulse of the input.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached. The final volume is also affected by the master volume controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioHdmiVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers the HDMI audio volume by 1% with each pulse of the input.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.HidUseAlternate
member.summary:
Property to select the destination Alternate where HID data will be sent. The selection will be active for as long as the input is true.
If both and inputs are high, the DM Net address takes precedence. HID data includes touch output data, and, if = false, keyboard/mouse data.
When set to "Alternate", the HID data will be routed to the alternate address specified by

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.ScaleTouch
member.summary:
Property to set the V-Panel's touch coordinates to the full range of analog values (0d to 65535d) for as long as the input is true. In this mode 0d,0d represents the top, left corner and 65535d,65535d represents the bottom, right corner.
When the input is false, the V-Panel's screen resolution coordinates are used, i.e., 800x600 or 1280x768.
This input should only be set true if touch output data is being broken out to the VMK-WIN (=true). true (level sensitive) = Use absolute touch coordinates (VMK-WIN); false = Use screen resolution.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.HidUseKm
member.summary:
Property to select the destination where keyboard/mouse (KM) data will be sent, as follows:
When the input is true, the KM data will be sent to the address specified by . This will break out the KM data to the VMK-WIN.
When the input is false, the KM data will be sent to the "DM Net" address (when = true) or the "Alternate" address (when = true).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.HidUseKmFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current HID keyboard/mouse setting.
The output remains true for as long as the setting is selected.
true = Breakaway destination selected; false = DM Net or Alternate destination selected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.TouchCalibrationInProgressFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that the touch calibration procedure is in progress.
The output goes true on the rising edge of pulse and remain true for as long as the procedure is in progress.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.TouchCalibrationPassFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the result of the touch calibration procedure.
When "Pass" is true, this indicates that calibration was successful. The output remains true until the next pulse of .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.TouchCalibrationFailFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the result of the touch calibration procedure.
When "Fail" is true, this indicates that calibration failed. The output remains true until the next pulse of .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceDigitalNoInputFlagFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that there is no HDMI source being routed to the DM input of the V-Panel.
The output remains true for as long as no digital source is detected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceDigitalSyncDetectedFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that video sync levels are detected at the DM input.
The output remains true for as long as sync is detected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceDigitalHdcpSourceFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the presence of HDCP, which requires compatible players and displays.
The output remains true for as long as HDCP is detected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceDigitalEnabledFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that the digital (HDMI) video is enabled.
The output remains true for as long as HDMI video is turned on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceDigitalDisabledFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that the HDMI video is disabled.
The output remains true for as long as HDMI video is turned off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceVideoLockedStatusFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that the video image has been locked.
The output remains true for as long as the video is locked. When the output is false, this indicates no picture.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceDigitalDisabledDueToResolutionFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report that the digital (HDMI) source has been disabled due to incompatible resolution with the V-Panel.
The VPG-12 supports 800x600 resolution; the VPG-15, 1280x768.
true = Video disabled; false = Resolution OK

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioBeepVolume
member.summary:
Property to set the beep audio volume.
Sets the corresponding volume level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioLineVolume
member.summary:
Property to set the line audio volume.
Sets the corresponding volume level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioWavVolume
member.summary:
Property to set the WAV audio volume.
Sets the corresponding volume level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioMasterVolume
member.summary:
Property to set the master audio volume.
Sets the corresponding volume level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioMicVolume
member.summary:
Property to set the Mic audio volume.
Sets the corresponding volume level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.LcdBrightness
member.summary:
Property to set the LCD brightness.
Sets the LCD brightness level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.StandbyTimeout
member.summary: Property to set the standby timeout (1d = 1 minute). The standby timeout is the period from the last use of the touchscreen before going into standby mode (screen display is off but power is on). Valid values range from 0d (no standby timeout) to 120d (120 minutes).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.AudioHdmiVolume
member.summary: Property to set the HDMI audio volume level from 0% (0d) to 100% (65535d). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.SourceVideoAnalogCableType
member.summary:
Property to set the Source Video Analog Cable type.
0d = DM, 1d = CAT6, 2d = CAT5e Use enum to convert the ushort value to the source video analog cable type enum or vice versa. This value is used to determine the cable equalization. Invalid values are ignored.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.UsbHidControl
member.summary: Property to set the destination for HID data when the address is set to "DM Net" ( = true). This input should be connected to the corresponding output HidSwitchCommandFeedback of the DVPHD System 2 Reserved Joins extender.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.UsbAlternateHidControl
member.summary: Property to set the destination for HID data when the address is set to "Alternate" ( = true). This input should be connected to the corresponding HidSwitchCommandFeedback of the DVPHD System 2 Reserved Joins extender.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.VpgGlassReservedSigs.UsbKmHidControl
member.summary: Property to set the destination for HID data when the address is set to "KM" ( = true). This address is used when the KM data is broken out to a VMK-WIN. This input should be connected to the corresponding output () of the VMK-WIN Configuration slot.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8X
member.summary:
The TPMC-8X is a 2-way WiFi touchpanel. It features an 8.4" active-matrix SVGA display, integrated 5-way thumbpad and up/down arrow buttons, and four programmable "softkeys" positioned below the touchscreen.
The TPMC-8X is built on the Microsoft Windows XP Embedded operating system, allowing it to run Windows applications.

member.param: Ethernet IPID of the device.
Control system this ethernet interface is a part of.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystem2ReservedSigs.ShutdownPanel
member.summary: Turns the touchpanel power completely off on the rising edge of the input. The next time the panel is turned on, it will go through a complete boot-up.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystem2ReservedSigs.Suspend
member.summary:
Suspends the touchpanel into a power down state on the rising edge of the input. This turns off the touchpanel display, shuts off WiFi and puts the processor to sleep.
The next time the panel is turned on, it will resume where it left off prior to suspending.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystemReservedSigs.PowerTimeoutUp
member.summary:
Increments the power timeout by one (1) minute with each rising edge of the input.
The power timeout function turns off the touchpanel display, shuts off WiFi and puts the processor to sleep when the touchpanel is inactive for the specified period. The power timeout has no effect when AC power is online.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the power timeout period will continue to increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches the maximum value of 120 minutes.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystemReservedSigs.PowerTimeoutDn
member.summary:
Decrements the power timeout by one (1) minute with each rising edge of the input.
The power timeout function turns off the touchpanel display, shuts off WiFi and puts the processor to sleep when the touchpanel is inactive for the specified period. The power timeout has no effect when AC power is online.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the power timeout period will continue to decrement every 25ms until the input goes false or until it reaches 0 minutes (no power timeout).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystemReservedSigs.PowerDownTimeout
member.summary:
Sets the power timeout in minutes (1 = 1 minute).
The power timeout function turns off the touchpanel display, shuts off WiFi and puts the processor to sleep when the touchpanel is inactive for the specified period. The power timeout has no effect when AC power is online.
Valid analog values range from 0 (no power timeout) to 120 (120 minutes).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystemReservedSigs.PowerDownTimeoutFeedback
member.summary: Reports the current power timeout period.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.WAVVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises WAV audio volume by 1% each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the reaches 100%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the volume will continue to increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.WAVVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers WAV audio volume by 1% each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the reaches 0%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the volume will continue to increment every 25ms until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.WAVBalanceLeft
member.summary:
Adjusts the WAV audio balance to the left by 1 each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the reaches +32767d (full right).
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the balance will continue to adjust every 25ms until the input goes low or until the limit is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.WAVBalanceRight
member.summary:
Adjusts the WAV audio balance to the right by 1 each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the reaches +32767d (full right).
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the balance will continue to adjust every 25ms until the input goes false or until the limit is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises the speaker volume by 1% each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the volume will continue to increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers the speaker volume by 1% each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the volume will continue to decrement every 25ms until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.MicVolumeUp
member.summary:
Raises mic audio volume by 1% each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the volume will continue to increment every 25ms until the input goes false or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.MicVolumeDown
member.summary:
Lowers mic audio volume by 1% each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%.
If the input remains true for 0.5 seconds, then the volume will continue to decrement every 25ms until the input goes false or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8BaseAudioReservedSigs.AllAudioBalanceLeft
member.summary:
Adjusts the speaker balance to the left by 1 each time the input is true. The input has no effect once the balance reaches -32768d (full left).

Valid values range from 0% (mute WAV audio) to 100% (maximum WAV volume). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

Valid values range from 0% (mute mic input) to 100% (maximum mic volume). Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XAudioReservedSigs.AutoSwitchAudioDeviceWhenDocked
member.summary:
Toggles the auto switch feature on and off with each rising edge of the input.
When auto switching is on, the panel switches automatically from the internal speakers to the external speakers of the wallmount docking station whenever the panel is docked.
When auto switching is off, the panel will remain on internal speakers regardless of the docking status. The speakers can still be switched manually through the panel's Setup pages, or via the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XAudioReservedSigs.AudioDeviceInternal
member.summary:
When the panel is docked (as reported by the WiFi Reserved extender), each rising edge of the input toggles between the internal and external speakers.
The input will toggle the speakers regardless of the auto switch status.
The input has no effect when the panel is undocked.

member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8X Audio extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XAudioReservedSigs.AutoSwitchAudioDeviceWhenDockedFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the status of the auto switch feature. When true, this indicates that auto switching is On; when false, auto switching is Off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XAudioReservedSigs.AudioDeviceInternalFeedback
member.summary: Indicates the speaker status. When true, this indicates that the internal speakers are active; when false, the external speakers are active.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.EnterBiometricSetup
member.summary: Opens the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog on the rising edge of the input. This dialog allows the user to configure the properties of the Biometrics database, e.g., it allows new users to be enrolled and enrolled users to be modified. It also adds/modifies categories and modifies the Biometric events.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.ExitBiometricSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.EnterWallmountDockingStationSetup
member.summary: Opens the "'Wallmount Docking Station Setup" dialog on the rising edge of the input. This dialog allows the user to configure the security settings of the wallmount docking station.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.ExitWallmountDockingStationSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Wallmount Docking Station Setup" dialog on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.DisableBiometricSensor
member.summary: Disables the use of the Biometric sensor for as long as the input is true. This signifies that when a user swipes their finger on the Biometric scanner, the panel will not identify the user, and thus no actions will be taken.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.EnterCertificateSetup
member.summary: Indicates that the "Certificate" dialog is open. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is open.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.ExitCertificateSetup
member.summary: Closes the "Certificate" dialog on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.InitializeJoins
member.summary: Method to initialize the sigs of the 8X Setup extender

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.EnterBiometricSetupFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog is open. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is open.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.ExitBiometricSetupFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog is closed. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is closed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.EnterWallmountDockingStationSetupFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Wallmount Docking Station Setup" dialog is open. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is open.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.ExitWallmountDockingStationSetupFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Wallmount Docking Station Setup" dialog is closed. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is closed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.DisableBiometricSensorFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the Biometric sensor is disabled. The output remains true for as long as the sensor is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.EnterCertificateSetupFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the "Certificate" dialog is open. The output remains true for as long as the dialog is open.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.ExitCertificateSetupFeedback
member.summary: Closes the "Certificate" dialog on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.BiometricSwipedUsernameFeedback
member.summary:
The username (as entered into the Biometrics database) of the last user who swiped their finger on the scanner and was correctly identified.
The string is in the format entered into the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.BiometricSwipedCategoryFeedback
member.summary:
The category (as entered into the Biometrics database) of the last user who swiped their finger on the scanner and was correctly identified.
The string is in the format entered into the "Biometric Configuration Properties" dialog.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSetupReservedSigs.BiometricSwipedFingerFeedback
member.summary:
Specifies which finger was swiped by the last user who was correctly identified.
The string will be one of the following:
"Right Thumb","Right Index","Right Middle","Right Ring","Right Pinky","Left Thumb","Left Index","Left Middle","Left Ring","Left Pinky"

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystem3ReservedSigs.EnableHardButton4Default
member.summary: Enables the default behavior of hard button 4 for as long as the input is true. The default function of hard button 4 is to release the panel from the wallmount docking station.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc8XSystem3ReservedSigs.EnableHardButton4DefaultFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates the status of the default behavior of hard button 4 (release panel from wallmount docking station).
When true, this indicates that the default behavior is enabled; when false, the default behavior is disabled.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DVPHD.DvphdSourceControlReservedSigs.SizeDefault

member.summary: Method to set the color values to the default settings.
member.remarks: This property applies to video (composite, S-Video and YPbPr) and analog RGB video sources.

member.summary: Video attributes.
